Description: Fragment of Fikellura painted pottery neck-amphora to which several fragments belong; shoulder, lotus flowers and buds, belly, crescents. Fragment (f) from belly: crescents.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (G), chamber 29 (probably)
Curator's comments: According to the Register, 12 fragments registered under the number 1888,0208.53 were kept in a bag marked 'all one vase, 29'. Most, or possibly all, of the 14 fragments today registered under this number were thus found in the Qasr, chamber 29. BSA xxxiv, 78 line 4. Attributed to the Mykonos Group (G 10a)
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. G. B. 577, 3)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD 228)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.211)
